steps.title: Create Phone Object
steps.content:
1. Every action for call & conference management is done via the Phoneâ€™s interface.
2. Phone object is the main interface for login & making a call.
3. Register the events call:incoming, call:connected, call:disconnected with the Phone object to handle the appropriate actions.

steps.title: Create Access Token
steps.content:
1. Before create the access token, refer the Sample App Deployment from JSDocumentation & create Developer Hosted server (DHS).
2. Get the app token url from DHS & request the access token.
3. Once token received associate the token with the user-id.

steps.title: Create Enhanced webRTC session
steps.content:
1. phone.login establishes Enhanced webRTC session so that the user can start making Enhanced webRTC calls.
2. Session ready event will be published after successfully logged into the the Enhanced webRTC. This event indicates that the SDK is ready to make or receive calls.

steps.title: Make a Call
steps.content:
1. Once you have registered handlers for all appropriate events you can use the phone.dial method with Account ID, call type (audio for audio only calls & video for video calls) & audio elements for local & remote media stream to start a call.
2. Call connected event will be published when a connection is established between two parties.

steps.title: Clear Enhanced webRTC session
steps.content:
1. phone.logout logs out the user from Enhanced webRTC session.
2. Session disconnected event will be published after logging out from Enhanced webRTC session. This event is published to indicate that the session was successfully deleted.
